image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will join a phone hook-up tomorrow night to discuss a possible joint peacekeeping force for Ukraine.

title.children: Albanese to join Ukraine 'coalition of the willing' peacekeeping call

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, dressed in miltary khakis, sits at a desk and writes with a pen.

props.synopsis: In the new poker game of international politics, Donald Trump is dealing the cards and Vladimir Putin has blinked and made a concession.

title.children: Putin showed support for a ceasefire — then came his real position

image.altText: A police car waits in the driveway of a suburban large property

props.synopsis: Sayet Erhan Akca, who is believed to have fled overseas after being charged with serious drug offences, is now a key suspect in the fabricated caravan terror plot.

title.children: Key suspect in Sydney caravan hoax fled Australia after facing drug charges

image.altText: Albanese situation room cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: The admission on a Perth radio station comes after the prime minister swerved questions at a Thursday press conference.

title.children: Albanese attended political fundraiser on same day as Dutton

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: The Department of Home Affairs says a woman who posted footage of herself taking a joey from its distressed mother left the country today.

title.children: Influencer who snatched baby wombat leaves country after visa review

image.altText: A container ship smouldering at sea, with charred shipping containers on board.

props.synopsis: New video shows the moment a cargo ship ploughed into a fuel tanker hired by the US military in the North Sea off England's east coast, as experts tell the ABC there is no evidence the ship's captain tried to take evasive action.

title.children: Video shows cargo ship hitting US military fuel tanker in North Sea

image.altText: Man in police outfit standing in front of a table and banner in the background.

props.synopsis: An Indonesian police chief has been arrested after the Australian Federal Police traced child abuse material to the province of East Nusa Tenggara.

title.children: Indonesian cop arrested after AFP tip-off over alleged child abuse material

image.altText: Protesters hold up signs

props.synopsis: US District Judge William Alsup said he was appalled employees were told they were being fired for poor performance despite receiving glowing evaluations just months earlier.

title.children: US judge orders Trump administration rehire thousands of sacked workers

image.altText: Chinese flag with cattle

props.synopsis: Hundreds of abattoirs in the United States are at risk of being banned from exporting meat to China, because their export licences are due to expire this weekend.

title.children: US meat trade days away from getting 'kicked out' of China

image.altText: A close-up view of a phone charging on a power bank

props.synopsis: Singapore Airlines has become the latest international airline to ban the use of portable power banks while onboard its flights.

title.children: The rules for power banks on flights are changing. Here's what to know

image.altText: person with parachute jumping off tall sand dune

props.synopsis: Travel plans have been thrown into turmoil after ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred left a trail of destruction prompting pleas from tourism operators for holiday-makers not to cancel their Easter getaways.

title.children: Families urged to stick with beach plans despite mass erosion from ex-Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: passengers standing on the wing of a plane with smoke

props.synopsis: The plane caught fire after a safe landing at Denver International Airport, forcing the evacuation of passengers using the plane's slides.

title.children: Passengers evacuate onto wing after jet catches fire following safe landing in Denver

image.altText: Two plastic containers with coloured tablets inside, held in the palms of a man's hands.

props.synopsis: Fiji health authorities are scrambling to stem an outbreak of HIV, as growing meth use and alarming needle-sharing trends accelerate the spread of the virus.

title.children: 'Bluetoothing': The shocking new trend fuelling HIV in Fiji

image.altText: Man sitting in the back of a police wagon surrounded by police.

props.synopsis: Alleged high-ranking Sydney members of the Finks outlaw motorcycle gang have been charged with what police describe as a targeted attack on a home south of Newcastle.

title.children: Five alleged bikies charged after home invasion where one was shot

image.altText: A flooded road.

props.synopsis: Homes and businesses flooded as the WA city of Albany received its highest rain total since records began in 1887.

title.children: Record-breaking wettest day causes flash flooding in southern WA

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Signage outside a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: The state's childcare regulator is looking into an incident where three children allegedly absconded from the centre.

title.children: Investigation launched after toddlers' escape from child care centre

image.altText: A woman stands in front of two other people, speaking.

props.synopsis: After revelations a purported antisemitic terror plot was a hoax, the federal Greens are demanding mandatory sentencing laws rushed through parliament in its wake be "revisited and repealed" — questioning whether the laws were pushed through under false pretences.

title.children: Greens demand repeal of mandatory sentencing laws after caravan hoax

image.altText: Dutton with backbench

props.synopsis: Female Liberal MPs have told the ABC they believe Peter Dutton is more palatable to women than Scott Morrison, with internal polling showing the women's vote lifting.

title.children: Internal polling shows female voters 'coming back' to Coalition

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's new car, stranded astronauts and crocs eating pigs

image.altText: A tight head shot of Simone McGurk talking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: It's nearly a week since the WA election was held — and while Labor won emphatically, a handful of seats remain in doubt. Here's a guide to what remains undecided.

title.children: Eight seats yet to be called days after WA voters went to the polls

image.altText: Dutton Australian flag concern

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is tantalisingly close to power, but the last steps will be the hardest.

title.children: Do voters fear PM Peter Dutton would be a surprise packet?

image.altText: A landscape of green grass with chickens roaming free and gumtrees in the background. A farmer walks among the chickens

props.synopsis: When Blythe Calnan and her partner bought their WA farm, they had a clear picture of how they wanted to manage it — by working with the environment to help protect it from future extreme weather events.

title.children: The 'no-brainer' farming technique helping to shore up our food security

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: For the first time, Victoria shifts to become a relative beneficiary in a new carve-up of the GST, and will receive a "significant" $3.7 billion increase to its GST take.

title.children: Victoria tips from 'giver' to 'taker' in GST carve-up with $3.7b boon

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Aussie share market has dodged a technical correction as iron ore and gold miners rise on higher commodity prices. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX dodges technical correction as miners rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Liontown Resources rises on narrower interim loss
CAR Group tumbles on ex-dividend trade

image.altText: A young female racing driver leaning on her car, holding her helmet, looking in the distance

props.synopsis: As one of the two inaugural Aussies on the grid in the all-female racing category, Aiva Anagnostiadis wants to be an example for other young girls who dream of driving fast.

title.children: Aiva only has a learner licence, but is inspiring young girls to go fast

image.altText: Versace wears a high-neck gold dress with textured shag

props.synopsis: Donatella Versace is replaced as creative director of the luxury fashion house Versace.

title.children: Donatella Versace steps down as creative director of fashion house

image.altText: Woman wearing pink jumper opens a weight loss injection pen with semaglutide solution.

props.synopsis: Health experts are concerned Ozempic and other GLP-1 agonist drugs may be inappropriately prescribed to people experiencing disordered eating.

title.children: Eating disorder hotline getting Ozempic queries raises concern

image.altText: a photo of two guys at the top of a mountain after a hike overlooking ocean

props.synopsis: The release on bail of two Bendigo teenagers charged with 13 assault-related offences has left their alleged victims fearing for their safety.

title.children: Mates allegedly bashed in Bendigo say they are not comforted by bail changes

image.altText: Donald Trump points his finger, wearing a red tie

props.synopsis: A trade war is escalating between the US and Europe with Trump taking to social media to threaten the EU with 200 per cent tariffs on alcohol.

title.children: Trump threatens EU with tariffs on alcohol, including wine and champagne

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan playing for the Western Bulldogs against the Sydney Swans.

props.synopsis: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan has trained sparingly in recent weeks, but Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge can't say when he'll be fully back in the fold as he continues to work through personal issues.

title.children: 'Too much uncertainty': Mystery surrounds Bulldogs star's availability

image.altText: Moon with small part in top right in shadow during partial phase of lunar eclipse.

props.synopsis: While America is set to see an incredible "blood moon" this week, only a fraction of Australians will see a sliver of the final moments of a partial lunar eclipse. Here's when and what to look for if you are one of the lucky ones.

title.children: Where and when can I see tonight's lunar eclipse from Australia?

image.altText: young boy in white tshirt on red roller coaster ride

props.synopsis: The heritage-listed Wild Mouse at Sydney’s Luna Park has undergone a massive multi-million-dollar upgrade after over 60 years of bringing cheer to people in the harbour city.

title.children: Iconic Luna Park Sydney Wild Mouse ride reopens after restoration project

image.altText: Michael Fassbender and Cate Blanchett lean in for a kiss.

props.synopsis: The latest film from Steven Soderbergh — starring Cate Blanchett and Michael Fassbender as a married couple of spies — takes a genre trope and makes it stylish and new.

title.children: Cate Blanchett and Michael Fassbender play married sexy spies in Black Bag
